Class PhaseEvent

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.ClientServer.Messages.PhaseEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Event
public class PhaseEvent extends Object implements Event
The PhaseEvent class represents an event in the system that encapsulates a specific phase within the game. It contains information about the player's current state during this phase and facilitates interaction with event visitors. This class implements the Event interface and serves as part of the event-driven architecture designed to notify and handle different game states through visitor-based processing. Features: - Stores a PlayerStateClient object representing the player's state in the game phase. - Supports JSON serialization and deserialization using Jackson annotations for easy data exchange. - Implements the Event interface to allow visitor-based processing and message retrieval. Responsibilities: - Encapsulate game phase information. - Enable visitor-based operations to handle the event appropriately.
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • stateClient

      public PlayerStateClient stateClient
      Represents the specific state of a player during a phase of the game. This variable encapsulates the player's behavior and available actions within the context of the current game phase. It is an instance of the PlayerStateClient class or one of its subclasses, which allows for polymorphic operations dependent on the specific game state. The stateClient can handle various functionalities such as rendering game views, providing available commands, and managing game-specific player interactions. It is utilized within the PhaseEvent to model phase-oriented player behaviors and actions in the game logic.

  • Constructor Details

    • PhaseEvent

      public PhaseEvent()
      Constructs a new PhaseEvent instance. This no-argument constructor initializes a PhaseEvent object with default values for its properties. It is primarily used for deserialization and scenarios where the event's properties will be set or configured later.

    • PhaseEvent

      public PhaseEvent(PlayerStateClient stateClient)
      Constructs a PhaseEvent with the specified PlayerStateClient object representing the player's state during a specific game phase.
      Parameters:
      stateClient - the PlayerStateClient object encapsulating the player's current state during the phase. This is used to represent phase-specific behavior in the game architecture.

  • Method Details

    • accept

      public void accept(EventVisitor visitor)
      Accepts a visitor for processing this PhaseEvent.
      Specified by:
      accept in interface Event
      Parameters:
      visitor - the EventVisitor instance that will handle this event

    • message

      public String message()
      Retrieves the message associated with this event. This method is intended to return a descriptive message relevant to the specific event. For this implementation, the method returns an empty string.
      Specified by:
      message in interface Event
      Returns:
      a string representing the message of the event, or an empty string if no specific message is provided.

    • getStateClient

      public PlayerStateClient getStateClient()
      Retrieves the player's current state in the game phase. The returned object encapsulates the state-specific behavior and attributes related to the player during a specific phase of the game.
      Returns:
      a PlayerStateClient object representing the current state of the player in the game phase. This object provides methods and data specific to the player's state within the context of the current phase.
